entry.title: Block CEO, Robinhood CEO Scuffle on Twitter Over Bitcoin Fees
entry.summary: Vladimir Tenev let Jack Dorsey know that he can buy his beloved Bitcoin more cheaply on Robinhood. Also: SBF has some thoughts.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Market Leaders Dip as Bitcoin Struggles to Maintain 40K
entry.summary: Potential regulatory approvals and institutional adoptions slowed, as did losses for most major coins.

entry.title: What Elon Musk Could Do for Crypto Twitter and Dogecoin
entry.summary: Musk probably won't get to buy Twitter. But crypto advocates should be cheering him on if they want to see Twitter ever really embrace crypto tools.

entry.title: Why NFT Artist Pplpleasr Prefers Rarible and Foundation Over OpenSea
entry.summary: Leading NFT marketplace OpenSea has a “first-mover advantage,” she said, but there’s nothing “super appealing” about its interface.

entry.title: NBA Teases Ethereum NFTs for Playoffs After Launching Discord Server
entry.summary: The NBA is ramping up its NFT and Web3 efforts following the success of NBA Top Shot—and it’s heading to Ethereum.

entry.title: Ethereum Privacy Tool Tornado Cash Says It Uses Chainalysis to Block Sanctioned Wallets
entry.summary: "Maintaining financial privacy is essential to preserving our freedom, however, it should not come at the cost of non-compliance," says Tornado Cash.

entry.title: Is Quantum Computing a Threat to Bitcoin?
entry.summary: Quantum computing has long been touted as a near-existential risk to the crypto industry. Is it?

entry.title: AMC Adds Dogecoin, Shiba Inu Payments to Mobile App
entry.summary: Now you can spend DOGE and SHIB within the movie theater chain’s app for tickets, concessions, and gift cards.

entry.title: Biden to Tap Former Ripple Advisor as Vice Chair of Fed
entry.summary: Law professor Michael Barr is being nominated to become the next vice chair for supervision of the Federal Reserve.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Down 8% Over the Week as Crypto Struggles
entry.summary: The leading cryptocurrencies are trending in the wrong direction as the broader market continues to slump.

entry.title: Robinhood CEO Says Dogecoin Needs Bigger Blocks to Be Internet's Currency
entry.summary: Robinhood chief Vlad Tenev took to Twitter to theorize how Dogecoin could become "the future currency of the internet and the people.”

entry.title: Portugal Grants First Crypto License to Bison Bank
entry.summary: Regulators in Portugal have granted the first crypto license in the country to Bison Bank.

entry.title: Dogecoin Co-Founder: Elon Musk's Twitter Offer Is a 'Hostile Takeover'
entry.summary: The meme-coin creator took issue with Musk, who has become Dogecoin’s top evangelist.

entry.title: SEC Proposal to Redefine 'Exchange' Is 'Unconstitutional', Says Coin Center
entry.summary: Research director Peter Van Valkenburgh says it would require "anyone writing or distributing [decentralized exchange] software" to register.

entry.title: Elon Musk’s Priorities for Twitter: Put Code on GitHub, Crack Down on Crypto Spam
entry.summary: In an extensive TED interview, Musk laid out his plan of attack for changes to Twitter if his buyout bid is successful.

entry.title: Investment Bank Stifel Downgrades Twitter to 'Sell' Amid 'Full-Blown Elon Circus'
entry.summary: The bank issued its updated guidance this morning following news that Tesla CEO Elon Musk had filed paperwork with the SEC to take Twitter private in a $43 billion bid.

entry.title: Luna Foundation Guard Adds to Terra Reserves With $880M LUNA 'Gift'
entry.summary: The 10 million LUNA transfer from Terraform Labs is mostly being burned to mint more UST stablecoins.

entry.title: US Treasury Connects North Korean Hackers to $622M Axie Infinity Exploit
entry.summary: The U.S. Treasury added the Ronin attackers' Ethereum wallet address to its sanctions list, tying it to the Lazarus Group.

entry.title: Nouns DAO Backs NFT Crowdfunding Effort for Indie Film 'Calladita'
entry.summary: The deal is throught to be the first on-chain proposal for a DAO to fund a feature film, and will see a Nouns NFT showcased on-screen.

entry.title: 'Sure, Why Not DOGE': SBF Explains How Twitter Could Be Decentralized and Monetized
entry.summary: After Tesla CEO Elon Musk’s $43 billion bid to buy Twitter, SBF imagined what an on-chain version of Twitter could look like.

entry.title: New York Man Charged With Running Unlicensed Bitcoin ATMs That Sold $5.6M in BTC
entry.summary: Prosecutors say that 35-year-old New York resident Robert Taylor aimed 'to keep his Bitcoin kiosk business as secret as possible.'

entry.title: Help Write Archie Comic Books With Palm’s Archieverse Ethereum NFTs
entry.summary: The 66,666 horror-themed NFTs unlock access to a virtual writers' room, with holders’ ideas tapped to create future comics.

entry.title: Ethereum Push Notification Service Raises $10.1 Million in Series A
entry.summary: Jump Crypto, Polygon Studios, Tiger Global and 1inch co-founder Anton Bukov are among the investors in EPNS, now valued at $131 million.

entry.title: Amazon Won't Support Crypto Payments Any Time Soon: CEO
entry.summary: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy says Amazon is not close to adding support for cryptocurrency as a payment option.

entry.title: Solana NFTs Now Heading to Rarible Following OpenSea Debut
entry.summary: Rarible expands its multi-chain approach even further while launching a custom marketplace for profile-picture NFT project Degenerate Ape Academy.

entry.title: Spencer Dinwiddie's New Sneakers Display The Live Price of Bitcoin—And Cost $41,000
entry.summary: The NBA star has partnered with Bitrefill to create Bitsneaks, a "super silly" pair of kicks that display Bitcoin's price in real time.

entry.title: Ava Labs Raises $350M to Build Out Avalanche at $5.25B Valuation: Report
entry.summary: Ava Labs, the company behind the development of the Avalanche blockchain, is reportedly in the process of raising a new round of funding.

entry.title: Elon Musk Offers to Buy '100% of Twitter' for $43 Billion
entry.summary: Elon Musk has made an offer to purchase '100% of Twitter' stock, following his earlier purchase of a 9.2% stake in the social media giant.

entry.title: Bank of Canada Using Quantum Computing to Simulate Crypto Adoption Scenarios
entry.summary: The researchers’ model can complete in half an hour what would take a regular PC longer than a human lifetime.

entry.title: Thorchain, Compound Lead DeFi Recovery With Double-Digit Gains
entry.summary: The crypto market has been in a week-long slump, but some decentralized finance (DeFi) assets are defying market trends.

entry.title: Major Indian Crypto Exchanges Halt Deposits Amid Regulatory Uncertainty: Report
entry.summary: The move risks confusing a crypto-savvy population, as policymakers debate how to regulate the sector.

entry.title: BlackRock to Handle Circle's USDC Cash Reserves as Part of $400M Funding Round
entry.summary: Circle projects $438 million in revenue from its USDC stablecoin reserves for this year and $2.2 billion in 2023.

entry.title: No VCs Allowed: How NFT.com Aims to Take On OpenSea
entry.summary: Shark Tank’s Kevin O’Leary and CEO Jordan Fried share their plans to debut a community-governed NFT marketplace.

entry.title: Most Wikipedia Community Members Want Crypto Donations Banned: Poll
entry.summary: Over 70% of voters in a Wikimedia Foundation poll were against the platform receiving cryptocurrency donations.

entry.title: What Is ‘The Merge’? Ethereum’s Move to Proof of Stake
entry.summary: The Ethereum mainnet is due to merge with the Beacon Chain in 2022, completing the blockchain's transition from proof of work to proof of stake.

entry.title: MetaMask Institutional Adds Ethereum Gnosis Safe, Custody Options for DAOs and DeFi
entry.summary: The institutional version of ConsenSys’s MetaMask can now be used for Gnosis Safe, Hex Trust, Parfin, and GK8.

entry.title: Tether Promises to Continue Cutting Commercial Paper Holdings
entry.summary: Commercial paper, a type of unsecured debt issued by companies, constitutes 30% of Tether's reserves.

entry.title: Dallas Cowboys Lasso NFL's First Crypto Exchange Sponsor Blockchain.com
entry.summary: The popular NFL team is the first to sign a cryptocurrency exchange as a sponsor following a recent league rule change.

entry.title: Luna Foundation Guard Adds Another $100 Million in Bitcoin to Back Terra
entry.summary: The nonprofit is converting stablecoin reserves from LUNA into BTC.

entry.title: 'Fan Token' Platform Socios Signs 13 NFL Teams
entry.summary: The Rams, Giants, and Buccaneers are among Socios’ new allies, but there are no NFL team tokens yet due to league restrictions.

entry.title: Astronaut Scott Kelly Discusses NFT Project, Crypto Holdings, and the Metaverse
entry.summary: Retired NASA astronaut Scott Kelly talks to Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward about his new Ethereum NFT collection, which benefits relief efforts in Ukraine, plus the cryptocurrencies he holds and his excitement about the metaverse.

entry.title: Gemini COO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Gemini COO Noah Perlman talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Gemini's approach to competing with other exchanges, its focus on regulatory compliance, and his own views on Bitcoin maximalists.

entry.title: Robinhood Crypto CTO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Robinhood Crypto CTO Johann Kerbrat talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Robinhood's new Lightning Network integration, potential NFT plans, and Kerbrat's personal history with crypto, including mining Bitcoin back in 2010.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 7: pplpleasr and the NFT Art Revolution
entry.summary: Emily Yang aka pplpleasr never thought she'd be an online celebrity. But in 2021 an NFT version of a digital ad she did for Uniswap sold for $525,000 to a DAO of her fans, and now she's among the most famous NFT artists. She speaks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the rise of NFT art, the traditional art world taking it seriously, NFT haters, and which NFT marketplaces can beat OpenSea.

entry.title: Ice Cube: Crypto and NFTs Are ‘The Ultimate Fuck You to the Mainstream’
entry.summary: The legendary rapper, actor, and entrepreneur Ice Cube talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about why his BIG3 basketball league plans to offer fractional team ownership in the form of NFTs, plus his personal interest in crypto.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto, Taxes, and You
entry.summary: Tax Day is coming, and the crypto world is paying attention. Decrypt's Jeff Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Adriana Hamacher discuss what people and businesses need to know about crypto and taxes with special guest Nicholas Mowbray of Baker Hostetler.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: Ditching Big Banks for Bitcoin With Caitlin Long
entry.summary: Caitlin Long spent nearly two decades at big banks Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley before she went all in on Bitcoin. Now her company Custodia is seeking to offer banking services to crypto companies long shut out by the big banks. She talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about identifying as a Bitcoin maximalist, crypto regulation in DC, and Web3 culture.

entry.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."

entry.title: Crypto Taxes Got You Down? Software Can Help
entry.summary: Tax season is upon us, and crypto investors have questions. Tony Dhanjal, Head of Tax at crypto tax software service Koinly, shares tips in this sponsored segment.

entry.title: Pastel Network's Georgiades: How to Protect Your NFTs
entry.summary: Anthony Georgiades, co-founder of Pastel Network, talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at Camp Ethereal 2022 about NFT security and the importance of protecting your digital artwork.

entry.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'
entry.summary: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.
